section.title: Introduction
section.para: FlyMine is an integrated database of genomic, expression and protein data for Drosophila and Anopheles. Many different types of data are held in a single database making it simple to browse and possible to perform sophisticated data mining queries. The icons below link to aspect pages provide more information about the different types of data and provide staring points for queries.

Browse data - All entries in FlyMine have a summary page includes data from all aspects. Some example gene: ..... and protein pages..... Enter any identifier or symbol in the Quick Search box to get started. [tutorial 1]

Template Queries - FlyMine has a powerful query interface that can run arbitrary queries on the integrated database. A library of pre-defined ('template') queries that simply require filling in a form is available. Find lists of templates on each aspect page or using the Template Search box below. [tutorial 2].

Design your own query - Advanced users can use a flexible query interface to construct their own queries. You can save queries you have created for future use and create your own templates. See the user manual and tutorials for more information.

section.title: Funding and contact details
section.para: The FlyMine project is based at the Department of Genetics, University of Cambridge and is a collaboration between the Genetics and Biochemistry departments of the University of Cambridge.
